attributes.action: Change the law on Mental Health declarations
attributes.additional_details:
Mental Health is on the rise more so in adolescence, From rough statistics from the NHS 70,000 students entering university will have a Mental Health issue this is an extortionate 450% increase! 

To break that down, there are 20,806 primary schools with an average of 150-300 students. There are 4,190 secondary schools with averages of 500-1200 students. Just on the bare minimum figures that equates to 3,120,900 students which 2% equates to 624,180 students able to access support at school.
attributes.background:
Following extensive research and discovering that there is 32,163 schools in the UK; only 2% have signed the Mental Health declaration this means that 25,731 did not sign. 
We are asking the government to make this compulsory and a priority, making it mandatory for schools to sign the declaration.

rejection.details:
It's up to individual schools what declarations to sign up to, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Create a statutory Mental Health & Wellbeing Policy for all schools & colleges: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611264
